intro: Trigonella aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian fenugreek, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that develop into pods containing several seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and is often found in dry, sandy soils. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its medicinal and nutritional properties. Trigonella aegyptiaca is cultivated for its seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
